info.description: Some introductory text should go here. Markdown is **totally** supported.
info.title: FBI Crime Data API

fieldsParam.name: fields
fieldsParam.description: Limit response to specific fields only

perPageParam.name: per_page
perPageParam.description: How many results to show per page. You might want to make this large for CSV downloads

pageParam.name: page
pageParam.description: Which page of results to show

incidentCountGroupByParam.name: by
incidentCountGroupByParam.description: Counts can be provided for statistics grouped by a list of one or more parameters

outputParam.name: output
outputParam.description: The format to return results in

yearParam.name: year
yearParam.description: Use this field to limit results to a single year. Note that a range can be specified by using the comparison operators and multiple arguments like `&year>2000&year<2010`

monthParam.name: month
monthParam.description: Use this field to limit results to the specified month. Multiple months can be specified with multiple query parameters or by using comparison operators in the query

stateParam.name: state
stateParam.description: The two-letter postal abbreviation for the state

oriParam.name: ori
oriParam.description: Search by ORI for the agency. Since ORIs are unique, it might make more sense to use the /agencies/:ori endpoint

agencyNameParam.name: agency_name
agencyNameParam.description: The name of the agency. Currently only supports exact matches.

tribeIdParam.name: tribe_id
tribeIdParam.description: Find agencies associated with a specific tribe. Use the `/codes/ref_tribe` API call to get a list of tribes

campusIdParam.name: campus_id
campusIdParam.description: Find agencies associated with a specific university campus.

cityNameParam.name: city_name
cityNameParam.description: Find agencies associated with a specific city name. This supports exact matches only and you should combine it with the `state_abbr`.

stateAbbrParam.name: state_abbr
stateAbbrParam.description: Find agencies within a specific state by its postal abbreviation.

populationGroupCodeParam.name: population_group_code
populationGroupCodeParam.description: The population group code is used to classify agencies by size of population served. To see the list of all codes, see `/codes/ref_population_group`

agencyOriParam.name: agency_ori
agencyOriParam.description: The ORI of the agency. You can provide multiple arguments.

reportedParam.name: reported
reportedParam.description: If the agency has reported either SRS or NIBRS. This makes the most sense when combined with a `year` argument.

reportedNibrsParam.name: reported_nibrs
reportedNibrsParam.description: If the agency has reported either NIBRS. This makes the most sense when combined with a `year` argument.

monthsReportedParam.name: months_reported
monthsReportedParam.description: Months in a year that the agency has reported either SRS or NIBRS. This makes the most sense when combined with a `year` argument.

monthsReportedNibrsParam.name: months_reported_nibrs
monthsReportedNibrsParam.description: Months in a year that an agency has reported NIBRS. This makes the most sense when combined with a `year` argument.

statePathParam.name: state_id
statePathParam.description: The two-letter postal abbreviation for the state

oriPathParam.name: ori
oriPathParam.description: The ORI for finding a single agency

codeTablePathParam.name: code_table_id
codeTablePathParam.description: The name of the code table to return the values for

victimsCountVariableParam.name: variable
victimsCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group victim counts by

victimsCountForOffenseVariableParam.name: variable
victimsCountForOffenseVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group victim counts by

offendersCountVariableParam.name: variable
offendersCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group offender counts by

offendersCountForOffenseVariableParam.name: variable
offendersCountForOffenseVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group offender counts by for within the specified offense

offensesCountVariableParam.name: variable
offensesCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group offense counts by

cargoTheftsCountVariableParam.name: variable
cargoTheftsCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group cargo_theft counts by

cargoTheftsCountForOffenseVariableParam.name: variable
cargoTheftsCountForOffenseVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group cargo_theft counts by

hateCrimesCountVariableParam.name: variable
hateCrimesCountVariableParam.description: A specific variable to group hate_crime counts by

offenseCategoryParam.name: offense_category
offenseCategoryParam.description: The names of SRS offense categories to search against

offenseNameParam.name: offense_name
offenseNameParam.description: A specific name for an offense in NIBRS

explorerOffenseParam.name: explorer_offense
explorerOffenseParam.description: For the convenience of the Crime Data Explorer, this method takes a generic crime offense name and searches against the specific SRS or NIBRS offense in the backend models

ori.description: The ORI is a unique identifier for retrieving the agency

legacy_ori.description: If the agency had a different ORI in the past, it will be stored here. Otherwise, it will be the same as the ORI.

agency_type_id.description: A code for the type of the agency

agency_type_name.description: A string description of the agency type

tribe_id.description: Identifier for a tribe in the `ref_tribe` table if the agency is associated with a tribe

campus_id.description: Identifier for a campus in `ref_university_campus` table if the agency is associated ith a university campus.

city_name.description: The name of the city associated with the agency.

state_abbr.description: The 2-letter postal abbrevation for the associated state

agency_status.description: A code for the agency status

submitting_sai.description: The SAI for the entity that submitted records for this agency

submitting_name.description: The name of the entity that submitted records for this agency

submitting_state_abbr.description: The state of the entity that submitted records for this agency

start_year.description: The earliest records in the database for this specific ORI. Note that agencies may have participated in the UCR program earlier and under other ORI.

dormant_year.description: The year a specific agency went dormant

current_year.description: The most recent year there is population and other demographic data for the agency.

population.description: The reported population for an agency. Note that the UCR definition of `population` is often smaller than the actual population that might be within an agency's jurisdiction and in many cases may be 0 Exercise caution when calculating rates with this number.

population_group_code.description: The code for the agency's population group

population_group_desc.description: A description of the agency's population group

population_source_flag.description: A source flag for the agency's population number

suburban_area_flag.description: Is the agency in a suburb

core_city_flag.description: Is the agency a core_city agency?

months_reported.description: How many months the agency reported either SRS or NIBRS in the current_year

nibrs_months_reported.description: How many months the agency reported either NIBRS in the current_year

covered_by_ori.description: The ORI of another agency that covered reporting for this agency in the current_year

covered_by_name.description: The name of the agency that covered reporting for this agency in the current_year

staffing_year.description: The last year this agency reported staffing numbers to the FBI

total_officers.description: The total number of officers reported for the staffing_year

total_civilians.description: The total number of civilian employees reported for the staffing_year

year.description: The year these participation details are for

state_name.description: The name of the state the agency is located in

state_abbr.description: The two-letter postal abbreviation for the state

agency_population.description: The unique population within the jurisdiction for the agency. The FBI UCR program does not overlap populations even though agency jurisdictions might overlap. This means that some agencies like state highway patrols or transit police might be assigned a population of 0, and that is not a bug

population_group_code.description: The FBI code for the population group the agency belongs to. For a full listing of all population codes, call the `/codes/ref_population_group`

population_group.description: The name for the population group the agency belongs to

reported.description: This is 1 if agency reported either SRS or NIBRS at least once in the given year

months_reported.description: How many months the agency filed a crime report in the given year

reported_nibrs.description: This is 1 if agency reported to NIBRS at least once in the given year

months_reported_nibrs.description: How many months the agency filed a NIBRS crime report in the given year

year.description: The year that these participation statistics were calculated for

total_agencies.description: The total number of agencies for the specific year

reporting_rate.description: A rate of which agencies have filed either an SRS or NIBRS report in the given year

total_population.description: The sum of the population within the jurisdictions of all agencies for that year

nibrs_reporting_agencies.description: The number of agencies who filed a NIBRS report in the given year

nibrs_reporting_rate.description: A rate of how many agencies filed a NIBRS report in a given year

covered_population.description: The total population within jurisdictions of agencies who filed either a SRS or NIBRS report in the given year. format: int32 type: integer minimum: 0

nibrs_covered_population.description: The total population within jurisdictions of agencies who filed either a NIBRS report in the given year. format: int32 type: integer minimum: 0

CountForYear.description: This object will almost always include an additional variable field with the value of the variable being counted. So. if you asked the API for counts related to `race_code` variable, each record would have a key like `race_code` and the corresponding value (ie, `B`, `W`) etc. for that count.

year.description: The year for which the counts were computed

count.description: A count for a specific value of a variable in a given year

CargoTheftCountForYear.description: Cargo theft counts also include dollar estimates for the values of stolen and recovered property

stolen_value.description: The total estimated value for stolen property in that count

recovered_value.description: The total estimated value for recovered property in that count

GeoCountyBasicInfo.description: Basic information about the county, as returned within the response for the /geo/states endpoint.

county_id.description: The internal identifier for the county within the CDE database

fips.description: The five character numeric code used to identify the county in the TK

GeoStateDetail.description: The record of metadata returned by the /geo/states/<state_id> endpoint to describe a single state

current_year.description: The most recent year of data for the state

fips_code.description: The two-digit FIPS code for the state

get.description: Returns a paginated list of agencies.

200.description: For success, returns a paginated list of agencies.

get.description: Returns a single agency by ORI

200.description: For success, returns a single agency.

get.description: The codes endpoint returns a listing of all the code lookup tables for codes that are used throughout the crime data explorer. Certain API endpoints will return either the codes or their corresponding values. This endpoint returns a dictionary mapping code table names to URLs for their lookup

This endpoint returns a list of values for a given code lookup table within the crime data explorer. Other API endpoints may return either the codes or their corresponding value in a given record, so this endpoints provides a comprehensive list of all possible values that you might expect to see. The actual structure of each result will vary depending on the code table you are requesting.
Returns basic information about the state
Returns just the participation data for a state

200.description: For success, return a paginated list of participation stats. Note that if you request `output=csv`, you probably want to also make `per_page` sufficiently large to include all data.
For success, return a paginated list of agency participation detail. With no parameters, this can get quite large, but you can provide filters to limit to specific fields.

get.description: Returns counts by year for incidents. Incidents can also be grouped for counting with the `by` parameter, which accepts 1 or more of the following fields in a comma-delimited list: `year`, `month`, `offense_subcat`, `offense_subcat_code`, `offense`, `offense_code`, `offense_category`, `classification`, `state`, `state_name`

200.description: Returns a paginated list of statistics for nationwide participation per year in revers chronological order

tags.name: cargo theft
tags.description: The FBI collects statistics about cargo theft

tags.name: hate crimes
tags.description: These API endpoints return data about hate crimes that have been reported to the FBI UCR program.

tags.name: national
tags.description: These API methods provide nationwide counts of crime

tags.name: trends
tags.description: Top-level trends for the national and state levels

tags.name: participation
tags.description: These API endpoints provide data on participation. This may mean either specific reports on if a given agency has filed crime reports to the SRS or NIBRS system in a given year or aggregated data on how many agencies within a state or county or city have filed SRS reports or NIBRS.

tags.name: meta
tags.description: These API endpoints return data about the crime data explorer database and its code values rather than specific crime statistics.

tags.name: nibrs summaries
tags.description: These endpoints return summarized counts for specific variables within the NIBRS sub-tables. This is what is used to populate the detailed histograms of offenders, offenses, victims and other types of information on the crime data explorer for states with agencies that participate in the NIBRS program. You must provide a variable argument as part of the call, but these endpoints will return counts of how many times each value occurred for a variable in a given year. For instance, using the `race_code` variable with the `count/victims` endpoint will return a count of how many victims of each race_code were in a given year. The `/offenses` API methods provide grouped counts for a specified variable, but only for incidents related to a single offense. For instance, the call `count/victims/states/OH/race_code?explorer_offense=aggravated-assault` would be used to get annual histograms of the race codes for victims of aggravated assault only.

tags.name: state
tags.description: These endpoints provide data for state-level views of crime
